1_1DFDjUGJdSp1kMuFq1AtNS9ZWmkVtbp947.body: I'm pretty sure your ids are stored in users.json in the data folder. Not online. Take that one with you to the other machine. (Or run zeronet on a private proxy.)

> [mario](#comment_4_1DFDjUGJdSp1kMuFq1AtNS9ZWmkVtbp947): That's what I did... the login interface can detect my correct ZeroID name but then ZeroMe asks me to create an account. I had an account before...

Did you wait for a bit? I just moved from one machine to the other, taking users.json with me,  and while at first the page didn't show properly after waiting for the ZeroMe user registry to sync it did.

Heh, [p2p](#comment_300_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ)'s comment showed up while I was writing this. Didn't even have to reload the page, pretty slick.

I was referring to the files page on ZeroHello. (Click on Files, above the list of site, and then click on one of the three connected circles icon behind one of the zites.)

1_15bmjskEVBxbkEpvt5EfKxFer7oA1vPLsM.body:
Afaik there is this thing called dynamic DNS that seems to deal with this issue. There are free services available like [no-ip](https://www.noip.com/).

Or if your registar / DNS hoster offers an API you could just write a script that updates your DNS records when needed. Assuming the IP doesn't change all that frequently.

1_1M1msf96AhLpJDJimVK7mXXCoaAGxfzxh9.body: And if LPD isn't enabled (haven't been able to tell myself). Then you could probably run a tracker on your local network and add it to the list of trackers in [Config.py](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/7905e12fc36127a0e8df38ff9943ce0f2997af3c/src/Config.py#L35).

Took me about 10 minutes to get a tracker going using qBitorrent (mostly because I forgot to turn off my vpn). All you have to do is check a box in the advanced options section.

https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/wiki/How-to-use-qBittorrent-as-a-tracker
